comments.commentBody:
You are correct. women are better off waiting to return to work until 6 weeks after the birth or longer.
New mothers also need more help from family members during this phase, particularly when so many modern doctors deliver by Caesarian, for many reasons.

Breastfeeding is directly related to how quickly a woman must return to the workforce. American women are faced with the worst maternity policies out of all the advanced countries -- most industrialized nations provide one year of paid maternity leave.  This is the policy we should be fighting for; what happens during the short stay in the hospital is relatively unimportant.
I like the Phelps tie-in.  Goes well with 11A.
How many is it? Twenty golds total to date? I would think that allows a certain amount of "not bad, old boy"....

Sorry about that midnight nonsequitor...

21 medals so far, of which a few aren't gold...tonight should make it 22.

When you look at a completed great Saturday puzzle, everything looks so easy that you can't imagine why it took so long to finish. I suppose it's possible that a MENSCHOIR would not have bass parts, but in reality, they all do. A particular piece for the choir might be written in unison, so wouldn't have a separate bass part, but you don't run across those very often. Almost all of the music would be TBB or TTBB. Don't think I've ever run acoss UTTERMOST before, just Utmost. The pinwheel symmetry was nice, with the triple 9s in each quarter.

I really admire Michael Phelps - what a job he's done. He has matured nicely, it seems, over the last 8 years.
Conservatives have really hurt themselves by their dependence on  socially conservative radicals.

Some in the chattering classes have wondered when Romney will have a "Sister Souljah moment" by rebuking one of the wingnuts on the right. And the answer is that it is not going to happen.

During the GOP primaries, Romney did not try to uphold the reality-based conservatism of his father, George Romney, that used to exist in much of the GOP. Instead, he egged on the GOP's ever rightward march on issue after issue and flirted with the most absurd of the conspiracy theories that occupy the minds of folks who watch too much Fox "News."

Since the primaries, Romney has continued on this path. Romney spoke at Liberty University and said nothing against that school's refusal to admit openly gay or lesbian students. Romney spoke to the NRA and gave tacit support to that group's ridiculous conspiracy theories about President Obama and guns. Romney trumpeted the endorsement of Ann Coulter, who has said that her "only regret with Timothy McVeigh is he did not go to the New York Times Building” and that she wants "Jews to be perfected" by becoming Christians. Romney won't disavow his own church's past practice of posthumously baptizing dead Jews.

Today's conservative movement is chock full of opportunities for a candidate to show some spine by standing up for reality, rather than crazed lunacy. Romney, however, is not the person to do so.

http://www.winningprogressive.org

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Winning-Progressive/195682780442236
If you keep up with those shouts and HOWLS, 'Owie,  you're going to need a present from the VOCAL CORD SANTA

Just a one time thang, LeapyL, due to the respectively LOUD entry clues and answers!

'Owie

FORGIVE MY "BAD MANNERS" JIM PAGE, TO YELLS AND "TALKS LIKE THIS" HOWEVER, YOUR SATXWDP OFFERING WAS SADLY "MISDONE!"

WHH

I agree, I used to take a few trips to NYC to do the things I cannot do here in Virginia - attend some Broadway shows and the Met Opera. I always felt safe there before these abusive tactics became standard procedures.

I will never visit NY or spend a penny there. I thought sheriff Joe in Az was bad, thousands of unconstitutional stop and frisks daily? We are losing our freedoms daily and I fear for the future of this country. We have lost our everlovin minds.

Abby, I won't eat the tasteless mush served on this side of the hills and Oakland and Berkeley are loaded with, yes, world-class restaurants and let's face it, 99% of the culture in the East Bay (and that's the high culture, no pun intended), but you're right about the lack of stores that sell basics, such as a suit of clothes. Living  in Oakland, Claremont, Rockridge, Elmwood, Temescal, Piedmont, Berkeley is a far more rarefied proposition than this article implies, and my friends to the west would wonder if services and businesses such as the best purveyors of books, art, music, vegetables, meats, fish, wine, fresh fruits, condiments, cheeses, coffee and baked goods I'm inconvenienced to have to travel to shop for are more vital to the quality of everyday life than a suit, which I'd travel to San Francisco to purchase in any and every case. Fortunately the completion of the fourth bore of the Caldecott approaches.

Or perhaps they just want to be re-elected? And to an institution in danger of negative favorability rating from the people they ostensibility serve? Aren't new representatives and senators told what their fund racing goals are immediately after being sworn in? And given directions to their first fund raiser?
What could it be that creates such job loyalty? The healthcare plan that many newcomers inquire about even before directions to their offices? Or is it the retirements benefits?
I heard rumors that for one Senator who had been appointed to fill the seat of a newly elected President, it was to have "Senator" carved on his tombstone. Even if true that can not be the motivation of everyone of these Honorable gentleman and ladies who will have to beg for money constantly for the rest of their term.
Which reminds me. How could you not honor the first patriot, Benjamin Franklin, who had to beg a French King for the modern equivalent of 12 billion dollars in soldiers, tents, guns, ammunition, etc. All while convincing said monarch that these 13 former colonies where really a country that would repay its debts! You who know how hard it is to constantly beg, couldn't you keep his signature achievement the Post Office alive and well?

You have hit the big nail right on the head: democracy itself is not only threatened, it has a core of dedicated, selfish and highly determined people trying to first defeat and then remove it.

Gov. Perry's plan, backed by many in the tea party Republican group, to stop the direct election of US Senators was but one example. Another is the idea that future votes on taxation would require a super majority in the Congress, something that would essentially put a stop to any functioning of government on the national level (just ask Californians about how Prop 13 has ravaged their state).

Then, of course, there are the efforts to restrict voting by requiring people to pay for IDs with money they might not have. Pennsylvania even floated the idea of having its presidential votes apportioned by Congressional districts, which would have ensured a Republican would carry the state because the districts have been shaped for partisan considerations by Republicans.

The massive amount of money pouring into SuperPacs is another effort to defeat democracy. All around, all across America, democracy is under siege.

I agree that democracy is under siege in this country by the Republicans. It's awful to have a divided government that can't get things done. But it's nothing compared to letting the Republicans take over Congress in our post-Citizens United World.

Unfortunately, some uninformed voters who are sick of the gridlock think that voting straight Republican will at least get things moving.

If that's happens, Wall Street, the banks and big oil will have free reign. They'll get exactly what they paid for with their millions of dollars contributed to SuperPACS that help get their shills elected.

It will be Bush's tax cuts on steroids, exploding the deficit and triggering massive cuts in government services--which is what they really want. The middle class will be forced to pay taxes to enrich the schemes of the wealthiest, many of whom have companies that get big government contracts or get tax breaks even as they move jobs overseas.

And if there isn't a crisis with Social Security, they'll create one. Because all they want to do is cut it and then give what's left of it to Wall Street to manage. They'll gut the department of education and turn it over to profiteers who want to sink their teeth into the billions of dollars of taxpayer money used to fund public schools.

I can't think of much that is more horrifying.

Republicans are determined to overthrow our Democratic form of government. It is apparent that they no longer have any desire to participate in a democracy. Their mission is to bow to the wealthiest class and leave the rest of us to survive the best we can. They are arrrogant and selfish and very destructive. They need to go!

I have noticed the exact same thing regarding the debt ceiling fiasco. The description of the downgrade referred specifically to political dysfunction and threats to default on payments for services already rendered, but some kind of amnesia has blocked this out of the conservative mind.  As for George Soros, he is a rare billionaire that has failed to naturally gravitate to the GOP and that has conservatives crazy. They are radicalized to the point of being a parody of themselves.
Failed is abit harsh.  When I do not get all the answers without some help, I like to think that God was acting through Ms. Check.
MacKnight,  thanks for yesterday's reference to Wheatbelly, and JolleyG, for rooibos tea. Some interesting food (and drink) for thought.

Failed in the NW corner. Had the long entries, but couldn't get the first 2 downs or the director's name.

Loved the fresh clues, even so.

Mac

Aetna most likely did not pay 118K. They have contracts that hospitals sign with fees much lower than the ones directly billed to patients. That is a problem as well. If I reach my coverage limit, or have a deductible, why do I pay so much more when rich insurance companies don't have to. I should get the same rate as they do. And the hospitals unbundle the services, so you never know how much it is exactly. It is really an unfair practice that should be stopped.

I hope Mr. Guha does well with his treatments. I have taken care of many young men and women with similar cancers. It is really tough. I wish him the best. Keep up the good fight.
Geez Judyw, calm down.
Well, actually me was cleaned today as well as my teeth.
I agree. McConnell is bought and sold!
He may not bluff, but he does lie.
How do you know that he is lying?

Third option is arrogant. He considers us too stupid or too distracted trying to find a job left in the USA by Bain and its ilk too pay attention.

Would you not say that he is correct given the low, low voter turnouts?
And how do you know this?  What sort of inside information do you have to back up your claim?
Harsh? - harsh is lying
Thank you. I was trying to remember who it was that he had given his tax returns to. It was McCain and he did give 10 years worth. And was politely thanked and sent along.........
How do you know he's lying?  If he is it's easy to prove.  Mitt just needs to release those returns.  Any guesses on why he won't?
We'll agree that his timing is impeccable. But is that good or is that bad?
But what does it say that Romney *won't* release them?

The questions regarding if Mitt paid or not is the democrats "birther" moment.  Somewhat embarrassing for the party i support. And Harry's ranting accusation without one iota of proof is cringe worthy.
Yeah Mittens release your wife's horses tax returns.
Geez, Chris he wrote a couple of books.  Duh!
